medical_history.chief_complaint: Pruritic rash on extensor surfaces of arms and legs
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 is a 5-year-old boy with a 2-year history of a pruritic rash that began gradually. The rash has not described specific intensity fluctuations but was exacerbated by infrequent moisturizing. Treatment with fluocinolone ointment led to resolution within 4 weeks. Patient 2 is a 51-year-old man who presented with a very pruritic rash that was newly worsening, also localized on the arms and legs. Histological examination confirmed spongiotic dermatitis, resolving with triamcinolone treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has no known allergies. Patient 2 has a history of asthma and HIV.
medical_history.family_history: Aunt with asthma in Patient 1; family history of atopy (notably asthma) mentioned as significant.
